result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Margeret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Blaine Anton Wendtland appeared by video.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch in court for Blaine Anton Wendtland. Attorney Hatch had nothing further to add to the motion. State objected to motion with argument. Attorney Hatch responded to States argument. Discussion was held regarding the turn over of any dangerous weapons. Court authorized a 24 hour release to allow the defendant to post his bond and pay his rent. Prior to defendants release, defendant is to give his key to Attorney Hatch, Attorney Hatch is to meet with law enforcement to get any dangerous weapons out of the defendants residence. Give them to law enforcement. Defendant is to return to the Columbia County Jail by 3:00 PM Saturday 8-6-22 if he has not posted his cash bond or a warrant will be issued. 3:00 PM
